span.style: font-size:18; font-family:Comic Sans MS; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#550000
font-size:14; font-family:微软雅黑; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#000000

item.answer:
【考法 1】 v. 呕吐出： to discharge by the throat and mouth; vomit
【例】 He cannot disgorge a fish bone without the doctor’s assistant. 没有医生的帮助他吐不出鱼刺来。
【例】The volcano disgorged lava.
【近】 belch[bɛltʃ], disgorge, eject, eruct[ɪ'rʌkt], expel, jet, spew[spju], spout
【反】 swallow, ingest 吞下，咽下
【考法 2】 v. 放弃： to give up on request or under pressure
【例】 The corrupt officials refused to disgorge his ill-gotten gains. 贪官们拒绝放弃赃款。
【记】 dis + gorge n.咽喉, 胃, 峡谷 v.狼吞虎咽, 暴食
【另】 Three Gorges 三峡
